Let's say I wanted to write code that takes in an arbitrary scheduler. In that case, I need to special case it like this:

>>> optimizer = torch.optim.SGD(model.parameters(), lr=0.1, momentum=0.9)
>>> scheduler = ReduceLROnPlateau(optimizer, 'min')
>>> for epoch in range(10):
>>>     if scheduler is not ReduceLROnPlateau:
>>>         scheduler.step()
>>>     train(...)
>>>     val_loss = validate(...)
>>>     if scheduler is ReduceLROnPlateau:
>>>         scheduler.step(val_loss)

which doesn't seem ideal. I would prefer to pass in epoch-1 or have epoch refer to the last finished epoch.

body:
Let's say I wanted to write code that takes in an arbitrary scheduler. In that case, I need to special case it like this:
```
>>> optimizer = torch.optim.SGD(model.parameters(), lr=0.1, momentum=0.9)
>>> scheduler = ReduceLROnPlateau(optimizer, 'min')
>>> for epoch in range(10):
>>>     if scheduler is not ReduceLROnPlateau:
>>>         scheduler.step()
>>>     train(...)
>>>     val_loss = validate(...)
>>>     if scheduler is ReduceLROnPlateau:
>>>         scheduler.step(val_loss)
```
which doesn't seem ideal. I would prefer to pass in epoch-1 or have epoch refer to the last finished epoch.
